TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit PromptStyle extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines a style for speaking prompts that consists of settings for emphasis, rate, and volume.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis emphasis) cil managed

Docs.param: The setting for the emphasis of the style.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies the setting for the emphasis of the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The speech synthesis engines in Windows do not support variations in the emphasis of speech output at this time. Setting values for emphasis using a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration will produce no audible change in the synthesized speech output.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptRate rate) cil managed

Docs.param: The setting for the speaking rate of the style.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies the setting for the speaking rate of the style.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume volume) cil managed

Docs.param: The setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies the setting for the speaking volume of the style.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the setting for the emphasis of the style.
Docs.value: Returns the setting for the emphasis of the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The speech synthesis engines in Windows do not support variations in the emphasis of speech output at this time. Setting values for emphasis using a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptEmphasis> enumeration will produce no audible change in the synthesized speech output.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.
Docs.value: Returns the setting for the volume (loudness) of the style.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume.Default> setting for <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume> is full volume, which is the same as <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.PromptVolume.ExtraLoud>. The other settings decrease the volume of speech output relative to full volume.
